newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turk PM attacks 'anti-Moslem' West after blazes.
newsitem.headline: Turk PM attacks 'anti-Moslem' West after blazes.

text.p: Turkey's Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan on Tuesday strongly criticised the West for the deaths of Turks in a recent spate of fires in Europe, which he said were the result of anti-Moslem sentiment.

"I call to the West, come to your senses. Stop this violence happening among you," Erbakan said in a speech to members of his Islam-based Welfare Party. "You do nothing other than increase tension on earth and apply double standards."

On Tuesday, a Turkish man was injured after a fire broke out at his home in the central German town of Haigerseelbach and investigators were not ruling out the possibility of a racist attack, police said.
Six members of a Turkish immigrant family died in the Netherlands last week in an arson attack being investigated amid suspicions that it may have been motivated by racial hatred.

On Monday German police said three members of a Turkish family had died after a fire broke out in their apartment in the west German town of Krefeld. Investigators believe it was set deliberately but there is no word on whether it was racism.
Turkey's relations with Europe have been strained in recent months by Turkish frustrations at a perceived lack of progress in its bid to become a full member of the European Union.
Erbakan said the education of children in the West encouraged anti-Moslem feelings which led to racist attacks.
"Television, novels and newspapers in your countries fan an Islam enmity campaign against Moslems every day and you just look on," he said.

Turkish State Minister Lutfu Esengun and a group of parliamentarians were to travel to the Netherlands and Belgium on Wednesday to investigate human rights abuses against Turkish citizens, the foreign ministry said.
Erbakan attacked Western countries for not meting out adequate punishment for those guilty of racist attacks.
"You have a big share of responsibility. You send the people who carry out these acts home after three days or do not punish them at all," he said.

Five members of a Turkish family died in a racist arson attack in the German town of Solingen in 1993. Four Germans were sentenced to between 10-15 years in prison on counts of murder, attempted murder and arson.
